sentences.english: I prefer to use debit card when shop on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 我通常喜欢用提款卡在网上购物。

sentences.english: So don. t lose sight of your healthy diet pyramid when you do your shopping.
sentences.chinese: 所以你购物时要记起健康饮食金字塔。

sentences.english: All grocery shopping bags contain at least one stick of French bread.
sentences.chinese: 所有超市购物袋里都装着至少一根法式长棍面包。

sentences.english: Have reached a shopping direction, sales and customers purchase contract signed.
sentences.chinese: 已达成购物方向后，销售人员和客户签署购销合同。

sentences.english: This outsider was fleeced when he was shopping in a local shop.
sentences.chinese: 这个外地人在当地的一家商店购物时挨宰了。

sentences.english: Cartrider bicycle created by Korean designer Jaebeom Jeong.
sentences.chinese: 韩国设计师设计的由超市购物车改装成的自行车。

sentences.english: Try to squeeze in the grocery trip in that intermediate time.
sentences.chinese: 尽量在此期间挤时间去购物。

sentences.english: Lotus Supercenter has been widely recognized by Shanghai people.
sentences.chinese: 易初莲花购物中心已经被上海人普遍认可。

sentences.english: Mypricemap is a smart shopping tool for all shoppers.
sentences.chinese: 比翻天是一个让消费者聪明购物的工具。

sentences.english: One Sunday, Jane and Alice went outside for shopping.
sentences.chinese: 一个星期天，简和爱丽斯一起去购物。

sentences.english: The busiest shopping area is Oxford Street, where famous large department stores are located.
sentences.chinese: 最繁华的购物区是拥有著名大百货公司的牛津街。

sentences.english: Zhang Fang and Grandma are doing some shopping in thenearby supermarket.
sentences.chinese: 张芳和奶奶正在附近超市里购物呢。

sentences.english: Luqing, can you go to shopping center?
sentences.chinese: 芦青，这个星期你能去购物中心吗？

sentences.english: Outside the city centre, the largest suburban shopping areas are Gosforth and Byker.
sentences.chinese: 市中心外，格斯福斯和拜克是郊区最大的购物区。

sentences.english: Sakura Shopping Center is a good place to go shopping.
sentences.chinese: 樱花购物中心是个购物的好地方。

definition: to take a walk/to window-shop/to stroll down the street
shopping mall/shopping center/department store/emporium/CL:家[jia1]/the business world
supermarket/abbr. for 超級市場|超级市场/CL:家[jia1]
to eat, drink and be merry (idiom)/to abandon oneself to a life of pleasure
